snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry said the president, Salva Kiir, had promised to take “forceful steps” to carry out a cease-fire pact he and his former vice president, Riek Machar, signed in January.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry says that he has secured commitment from South Sudan Pres Salva Kiir to open talks with his rebel opponent Riek Machar; talks, which will focus on implementing cease-fire, represent Obama administration's latest bid to halt fighting that has killed thousands.
lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry said the president, Salva Kiir, had promised to take “forceful steps” to carry out a cease-fire pact he and his former vice president, Riek Machar, signed in January.

headline.main: South Sudan Will Talk With Rebels, Kerry Says
headline.print_headline: South Sudan Will Talk With Rebels, Kerry Says
